results.title: The Conquered desert: Libya
results.brief_description: The Libyan Arab Republic since the revolution of September 1969 has progressed in many ways. There has been a development of an infrastructure of industry and agriculture. There is education for all, cultural centres, housing and health services. In fact, total self-sufficiency has been achieved since the revolution.

results.title: The Confessional = Le Confessionnal
results.creator_credit: Cinemaginaire, Enigma Films, Cinea, Denise Robert, David Puttnam, Philippe Carcassonne and Robert Robert Lepage
results.brief_description: Past, present and the world of cinema merge in this unique and visually innovate thriller. Quebec, 1952, and the church is abuzz as master director Alfred Hitchcock (played by Ron Burrage) is in town to film “I Confess”. An equally gripping story is going on in the background - the elements echoing that of the plot, as 16 year old church worker, Rachel (Suzanne Clement), is with child to an unknown father, only a young priest knows the truth. Quebec, 1989 and Pierre (Lothaire Bluteau) returns home to attend the funeral of his father. During his stay Pierre vows to solve the mystery of the parentage of his half brother, Marc (Patrick Goyette)- Rachel’s son, a discontented rent boy and father of a young child. Pierre’s mission is not an easy one, as the secrets of the past and heredity cloud the situation and find resonance in the future. Like the plot of Hitchcock’s film, only one man holds the key to past and present that was disclosed to him in the confines of the confessional. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part two, conductor Verdon Williams discusses the tasks that a conductor must do before each performance - choosing the number and type of instruments needed; studying the melody and style of the music. Shows him rehearsing an orchestra and a choir.

results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part one, conductor Verdon Williams discusses his role within the orchestra, use of the baton to keep rhythm; different kinds of rhythms; emphasising staccatto, accents; bringing in new instruments; starting and finishing each movement.

results.title: The Conciliation by Benjamin Duterrau, 1840
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye II”.
This film looks at the works of Benjamin Duterrau, and in particular his painting “The Conciliation”. This was of importance as, based on the meeting of George Augustus Robinson in 1830 with a group of Tasmanian aborigines, it was the first painting of a historical scene created in Australia.

results.title: The Concert for Bangla Desh
results.creator_credit: Apple, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, George Harrison, Allen Klein and Saul Swimmer
results.brief_description: Filmed live performance of a special benefit concert for the starving refugees of Bangla Desh in New York’s Madison Square Gardens in 1971. A collaborative effort by George Harrison and Ravi Shankar, this amazing concert assembled together some of the greats in the British and American rock music industry including Eric Clapton, Bob Dylan, Billy Preston, Leon Russell, Ringo Starr, Ali Akbar Khan, Klaus Voorman, Badfinger. The first half of the concert features an Indian music presentation led by Ravi Shankar followed by George Harrison and his guest performers in the second half. The concert raised $US250,000 with further monies raised through record sales. Songs include “My sweet Lord “, “It don’t come easy”, “Here comes the sun”, “Just like a woman”, “A Hard rain’s gonna fall”. Also includes documentary footage of Bangla Desh.

results.title: The Concert (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mark O'Connor, Black-And-White Color Film and Claude Chagrin
results.brief_description: The film debut of comic artist Julian Chagrin. Filmed in Technicolour in London, we see the performing artist’s arrival at the Royal Albert Hall. He gives an impromptu and unusual performance before a delighted crowd, establishing himself as a master of his chosen instrument - a pedestrian crossing.
